name: Yellow lentil Dal Stew/soup with Carrots and Zucchini/Brussels sprouts (Mung Daal)
description: A quick lentil stew/soup with yellow lentils and some veggies. Vegan and Glutenfree
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup yellow mung lentils or pink lentils (split skinless mung bean or red lentil, washed and soaked for atleast half an hour)
1/2 teaspoon salt or more to taste
1/4 cup chopped or grated zucchini (or 1/4 cup chopped Brussels sprouts)
2 teaspoons organic canola oil or any organic oil with high smoke point
1  green chili chopped or to taste (or red chili flakes)
3  medium garlic cloves chopped or minced

recipeInstructions.text: In a deep pan or pressure cooker, add oil and heat on medium
recipeInstructions.name: In a deep pan or pressure cooker, add oil and heat on medium

recipeInstructions.text: Add mustard seeds an wait for them to sputter.
recipeInstructions.name: Add mustard seeds an wait for them to sputter.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the asafoetida, fennel seeds and curry leaves and mix. Cook for half a minute
recipeInstructions.name: Add the asafoetida, fennel seeds and curry leaves and mix. Cook for half a minute

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chilli and garlic and cook for 5-7 minutes stirring frequently till the garlic browns up evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chilli and garlic and cook for 5-7 minutes stirring frequently till the garlic browns up evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the carrots and Zucchini or Brussels Sprouts or both. You can add some other veggies per preference. Cook for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the carrots and Zucchini or Brussels Sprouts or both. You can add some other veggies per preference. Cook for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the tomato, turmeric and cook for 2-3 minutes until tomatoes get mushy,
recipeInstructions.name: Add the tomato, turmeric and cook for 2-3 minutes until tomatoes get mushy,

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the lentils and add them to the pan, add salt, and water and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the lentils and add them to the pan, add salt, and water and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Pressure cook for 1 whistle (5 minutes on high pressure after pressure indicator turns on) or cook covered on low for 20-30 minutes until the lentils are tender and mushy.
recipeInstructions.name: Pressure cook for 1 whistle (5 minutes on high pressure after pressure indicator turns on) or cook covered on low for 20-30 minutes until the lentils are tender and mushy.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot topped with chopped cilantro leaves or red chili flakes, with Roti/Naan Indian flat bread, Rice, dry veggie subzis or as a soup with garlic bread.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot topped with chopped cilantro leaves or red chili flakes, with Roti/Naan Indian flat bread, Rice, dry veggie subzis or as a soup with garlic bread.

recipeInstructions.text: To refresh the daal the next day, in a small pan, add a teaspoon of oil, heat on medium, add 1/4 teaspoon mustard seeds, 3-4 curry leaves and chili flakes. Wait for the mustard seeds to sputter. Pour this over the heated Daal and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: To refresh the daal the next day, in a small pan, add a teaspoon of oil, heat on medium, add 1/4 teaspoon mustard seeds, 3-4 curry leaves and chili flakes. Wait for the mustard seeds to sputter. Pour this over the heated Daal and serve.

keywords: Gluten free daal, vegan daal, vegetable daal
